intro: Dyschoriste erythrorhiza, commonly known as the red-root dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its erect stem, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers. Its roots are reddish in color, which gives it its common name. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
